title: What are some good contemporary hip hop songs with a funky James Brown like feel, similar to Nelly's 'Hot in Herre'? - Quora

response.answer_text: While there are a ton of hip-hop songs that sample and reference James Brown, "Hot In Herre" is actually not one of them, it uses a sample of a song by Chuck Brown and the Soul Searchers called "Bustin' Loose."  http://www.ethanhein.com/wp/2010/ashleys-roachclip/ The most-sampled James Brown song is "The Funky Drummer Parts One And Two." Here's a blog post about it. http://www.ethanhein.com/wp/2009/the-natural-history-of-the-funky-drummer-break/ Another very widely used James Brown sample is "Cold Sweat." http://www.ethanhein.com/wp/2010/cold-sweat-in-the-terrordome/ Still another: "I Know You Got Soul" by Bobby Byrd. http://www.ethanhein.com/wp/2010/eric-b-and-rakim/ More JB samples to look into: "Funky President," "The Payback," and "Think" by Lyn Collins.

I'm not 100% sure that I get the question -- it would be helpful if you could name two other songs that you view as analogues.  But here's a crack at an answer...  I have a Spotify playlist called Joy and here are some songs on it that remind me of Hot in Herre: Get it Poppin' by Fat Joe (feat. Nelly)Wat Da Hook Gon Be by Murphy Lee (feat.
